scene_metadata.title: The Cost of Meaning
scene_metadata.psychological_theme: freedom balanced between fear and meaninglessness

dialogue.context: dressed as philosophy professor, in a college class, in front of an undetermined audience
dialogue.text: If you only ever act in ways that protect you from cost, you're not freeâ€”you're managed by your fears. But if there were no cost, no stakes, then your actions wouldn't matter. You'd be choosing between paper and more paper.

psychological_notes: The architect articulates how freedom exists in the tension between safety and meaning. Too much self-protection and we become slaves to fear. Too little consequence and our choices become arbitrary. The 'paper and more paper' metaphor brilliantly captures the emptiness of consequence-free choice.
philosophical_underpinning: Meaningful freedom exists in the space between paralysis and meaninglessness
therapeutic_direction: Finding the courage to risk while accepting the necessity of consequence
